benchmark_details.name: WikiFactDiff
benchmark_details.overview: WikiFactDiff is a large dataset for factual knowledge updates of language models, depicting the evolution of knowledge between two dates via new, obsolete, and static facts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset for evaluating factual knowledge update algorithms in language models.

data.source: Constructed from raw snapshots of the Wikidata knowledge base.
data.annotation: Automatically generated updates based on changes in Wikidata.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the updated model's ability to correctly predict facts from cloze tests.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by high efficacy and low bleedover.
methodology.baseline_results: ROME outperforms other algorithms with high efficacy and minimal impact on specificity.
methodology.validation: Evaluation of existing update algorithms on the WikiFactDiff dataset.
